ygData.subject: Re: Lowest price possible on medium steel
ygData.msgSnippet: I had thought about trying to buy regular plate from someone upgrading to rubicite or something else, and I realized that the resale value, to a vendor, is
ygData.messageBody:
I had thought about trying to buy regular plate from someone upgrading to
rubicite or something else, and I realized that the resale value, to a
vendor, is very high. I believe it's not too far distant from the buying
price. I suppose someone may unload at a lesser cost because they are
encumbered heavily, at the source of the new armor, but I figured it was a
long shot at best and decided to just wait until I could buy.

I've seen the breatplate for low 800's. That's with Cha 113 and
Charismatic Charillion to Amiable. Faction seems to play a MUCH higher role
than Cha... My base is 90 from which I compare it to.


>From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>
>
>i created a gnome enchanter with max charisma and bought all my small steel
>at the lowest possible prices in akanon. i assume the same would be for a
>human enchanter with max charisma in freeport or a high elf enchanter in
>felwithe.
>Shada Silverleaf, Level 50 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
>Erisi, Level 15 Paladin, Mithaniel Marr
>
>
>It is my knowledge that steel plate can only be bought from vendors
>generally (unless someone is upgrading and wishes to sell their old plate,
>right??) I was just wondering what the minimun price would be for medium
>steel plate, and what charisma/faction it takes for that??
>
>
